taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Inhabit quiet pools and backwaters of creeks and small to large rivers, swamps, lakes and overflow areas of large streams.  Often occur near vegetation and submerged logs.  Feed on other fishes and insects.  Spawning occurs over vegetation or other submerged objects (Ref. 10294).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  USA in Mississippi River basin from south central Ohio, north Indiana, and Wisconsin to Montana and south to north Alabama and Louisiana; Lake Michigan drainage, Wisconsin ; Calcasieu and Mermentau rivers on Louisiana Gulf Coast.
dataObjects.references: Page, L.M. and B.M. Burr 1991 A field guide to freshwater fishes of North America north of Mexico. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 432 p. (Ref. 5723)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.description: 88.0 cm TL (male/unsexed; (Ref. 40637)); max. published weight: 2,600 g (Ref. 40637); max. reported age: 20 years (Ref. 12193)
references: IGFA 2001 Database of IGFA angling records until 2001. IGFA, Fort Lauderdale, USA. (Ref. 40637)

Hugg, D.O. 1996 MAPFISH georeferenced mapping database. Freshwater and estuarine fishes of North America. Life Science Software. Dennis O. and Steven Hugg, 1278 Turkey Point Road, Edgewater, Maryland, USA. (Ref. 12193)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Associations
dataObjects.title: Known predators
dataObjects.description:
Lepisosteus platostomus is prey of:
Homo sapiens

This list may not be complete but is based on published studies.

dataObjects.title: Known prey organisms

zooplankton
